faqs.question: How many colleges and departments are there in SVU?
faqs.answer: SVU has 5 constituent colleges: College of Arts, College of Sciences, College of Commerce, Management & Computer Science, College of Pharmacy, and College of Engineering. It accommodates 52 departments offering 88 programs.

faqs.question: Which academic disciplines does the College of Arts at SVU include?
faqs.answer: The College of Arts at SVU includes departments such as Adult Education, Economics, English, Fine Arts, History, Human Rights, Journalism, Library Science, Music, Performing Arts, Political Science, Population Studies, Psychology, Sociology, Telugu, and more.

faqs.question: What programs are offered in the College of Arts at SVU?
faqs.answer: Programs include B.A., M.A., M.Ed., M.L.I.Sc., MSW, M.J.M.C., Postgraduate diplomas, and Ph.D. programs across various humanities and social sciences.

faqs.question: What is the College of Science known for at SVU?
faqs.answer: The College of Science is known for strong research contributions, modern laboratories, and departments spanning physical, biological, mathematical, and computational sciences.

faqs.question: How many departments are under the College of Science, SVU?
faqs.answer: The College of Science comprises departments including Biochemistry, Biotechnology, Botany, Chemistry, Environmental Science, Geography, Geology, Mathematics, Physics, Statistics, Zoology, and more.

faqs.question: What engineering programs does the College of Engineering, SVU, offer?
faqs.answer: The College of Engineering offers B.Tech, M.Tech, MCA, and Ph.D. programs across civil, mechanical, electrical, electronics, computer science, and chemical engineering disciplines.

faqs.question: Is SVU College of Engineering autonomous?
faqs.answer: Yes, SVU College of Engineering is an autonomous institution recognized for academic flexibility and innovation.

faqs.question: Does SVU offer Data Science courses?
faqs.answer: Yes, SVU offers Data Science programs through SVU Data Science Center (svudatascience.in), including PG courses and industry-oriented training.

faqs.question: What courses does the College of Pharmaceutical Sciences at SVU offer?
faqs.answer: The College of Pharmaceutical Sciences offers B.Pharm, M.Pharm, Pharm.D, and Ph.D. programs with focus areas like pharmaceutics, pharmacology, pharmaceutical chemistry, and clinical pharmacy.

faqs.question: Is SVU accredited by NAAC?
faqs.answer: Yes, Sri Venkateswara University has been accredited by NAAC with an A+ grade for academic excellence.

faqs.question: Does SVU support research programs?
faqs.answer: Yes, SVU strongly supports research through funded projects, research centers, Ph.D. programs, and collaborations with national agencies.

faqs.question: What is the language of instruction at SVU?
faqs.answer: English is the primary medium of instruction across most programs.

faqs.question: Does SVU offer Ph.D. programs?
faqs.answer: Yes, almost every department provides full-time and part-time Ph.D. programs.

faqs.question: Does SVU offer Biotechnology courses?
faqs.answer: Yes, SVU offers UG, PG, and Ph.D. programs in Biotechnology.

faqs.question: Does SVU offer Computer Science programs?
faqs.answer: Yes, SVU offers B.Tech CSE, M.Tech, MCA, and research programs in Computer Science.

faqs.question: Is the SVU data science program industry-aligned?
faqs.answer: Yes, SVU Data Science programs include real-time projects and industry mentorship.

faqs.question: Does SVU offer Music and Fine Arts education?
faqs.answer: Yes, the College of Arts offers specialized programs in Music and Fine Arts.

faqs.question: Does SVU offer Psychology courses?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Department of Psychology offers UG, PG, and research programs.

faqs.question: What is the duration of B.Tech programs at SVU?
faqs.answer: B.Tech programs typically last 4 years.

faqs.question: What is the duration of M.Tech programs?
faqs.answer: M.Tech programs usually span 2 years.

faqs.question: Does SVU provide campus Wi-Fi?
faqs.answer: Yes, Wi-Fi access is available across academic and residential blocks.

faqs.question: Does SVU offer Chemistry specialization programs?
faqs.answer: Yes, SVU offers M.Sc. and Ph.D. programs in Organic, Inorganic, and Physical Chemistry.

faqs.question: Does SVU provide student counseling services?
faqs.answer: Yes, SVU offers academic and psychological counseling services.

faqs.question: What is the mission of the SVU College of Arts?
faqs.answer: The mission includes designing and offering relevant academic programs, promoting research, establishing collaborations with national and international organizations, and addressing societal needs through extension activities.

faqs.question: How many departments are in the SVU College of Arts?
faqs.answer: The S.V.U. College of Arts has 22 departments offering a variety of courses in Humanities and Social Sciences.

faqs.question: When was the Department of Education at SVU established?
faqs.answer: The Department of Education was established in 1961. It was later upgraded to a College of Education in 1986 and then to the Institute of Advanced Study in Education (IASE) in 1996.

faqs.question: What courses are offered by IASE at SVU?
faqs.answer: IASE offers programs such as B.Ed., M.Ed., M.Phil., and Ph.D. in Education.

faqs.question: What are the key functions of IASE?
faqs.answer: Key functions include pre-service teacher education, in-service training for teachers and teacher educators, development of research and instructional materials, and providing academic support to District Institutes of Education and Training (DIETs).

faqs.question: What is the vision of SVU College of Arts?
faqs.answer: The vision is to inculcate accountability and responsibility among students through academics, preparing them as makers of future India.

faqs.question: What programs does SVU College of Arts offer?
faqs.answer: The college offers Post Graduate Degrees, Ph.D. programmes, PG Diplomas in some courses, and Certificate Courses.

faqs.question: What are Dr. K. Sudha Rani's academic qualifications?
faqs.answer: She holds a B.Sc. (1985), M.A. in Adult Education (1987, Gold Medal), and Ph.D. in Adult Education (1992) from Sri Venkateswara University.

faqs.question: What types of courses are offered at the College of Arts?
faqs.answer: The college offers Undergraduate (in select streams), Postgraduate (MA, M.Com, M.Ed, M.L.I.Sc, etc.), and Research (Ph.D.) programs.

faqs.question: What facilities are available at the College of Arts?
faqs.answer: The college includes digital classrooms, a central library (and departmental libraries), seminar halls, an auditorium, and computer labs for specific departments.

faqs.question: How many departments are there in the College of Arts?
faqs.answer: There are approximately 25+ departments spanning languages, social sciences, and professional courses.

faqs.question: Are there separate blocks for different departments?
faqs.answer: Yes, departments are distributed across the Arts Block, Commerce Block, Prakasam Bhavan, and other auxiliary buildings.

faqs.question: Does the college have a Department of English?
faqs.answer: Yes.

faqs.question: Is there a Department of Telugu Studies?
faqs.answer: Yes.

faqs.question: Does the college offer Hindi courses?
faqs.answer: Yes, through the Department of Hindi.

faqs.question: Are there departments for classical languages?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Department of Sanskrit.

faqs.question: Does the college offer Urdu?
faqs.answer: Yes, through the Department of Urdu.

faqs.question: Are Tamil studies available?
faqs.answer: Yes, through the Department of Tamil.

faqs.question: Is there a Department of Linguistics?
faqs.answer: Yes.

faqs.question: Is there a Department of Economics?
faqs.answer: Yes.

faqs.question: Does the college have a History department?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Department of History and Archeology.

faqs.question: Is there a Sociology department?
faqs.answer: Yes.

faqs.question: Does the college offer Social Work courses?
faqs.answer: Yes, through the Department of Social Work.

faqs.question: Is there a Department of Population Studies?
faqs.answer: Yes.

faqs.question: Does the college have a Department of Human Rights?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Department of Human Rights and Social Development.

faqs.question: Is Philosophy offered?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Department of Philosophy.

faqs.question: Does the college have a Department of Ancient Indian History?
faqs.answer: Yes, AIHC & Archaeology.

faqs.question: Does the College of Arts include Commerce?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Department of Commerce is a major department.

faqs.question: Is Management Studies (MBA) part of this college?
faqs.answer: Yes, typically under the Department of Management Studies (though sometimes treated as a separate school, it falls under the Arts/Commerce faculty umbrella).

faqs.question: Is there a Department of Law?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Department of Law.

faqs.question: Is Library Science offered?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Department of Library and Information Science.

faqs.question: Is there a Department of Adult Education?
faqs.answer: Yes.

faqs.question: Does the college have a Performing Arts department?
faqs.answer: Yes.

faqs.question: Is Women's Studies offered?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Department of Women's Studies.

faqs.question: Does the college have a Department of Anthropology?
faqs.answer: Yes.

faqs.question: Is there a Department of Communication/Journalism?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Department of Communication and Journalism.

faqs.question: Is IASE a separate college?
faqs.answer: It functions as a specialized department/institute within the university structure, often linked with the College of Arts/Education faculty.

faqs.question: What courses are offered at IASE?
faqs.answer: B.Ed (Bachelor of Education), M.Ed (Master of Education), and Ph.D. in Education.

faqs.question: Does IASE offer distance education courses?
faqs.answer: Regular courses are offered on campus; distance B.Ed is handled separately by the DDE.

faqs.question: When was the Department of Education upgraded to IASE?
faqs.answer: It was upgraded under the MHRD scheme to strengthen teacher education.

faqs.question: What kind of events are hosted by the College of Arts?
faqs.answer: National Seminars, International Conferences, Workshops, and Refresher Courses.

faqs.question: Are there induction programs for new students?
faqs.answer: Yes, at the start of the academic year.

faqs.question: Do departments hold individual events?
faqs.answer: Yes, departments like English, Economics, and Law frequently hold guest lectures and symposiums.

faqs.question: What is the duration of MA courses?
faqs.answer: Two years (4 Semesters).

faqs.question: Does the college have a placement cell?
faqs.answer: Yes, there is a central placement cell, and specific departments (like MBA/Commerce) have active placement drives.

faqs.question: How are conflicts or disputes regarding EC decisions handled?
faqs.answer: They may be addressed through statutory appeals, government or Chancellor’s review, or legal recourse, as provided under the Act.

faqs.question: Who founded Sri Venkateswara University?
faqs.answer: SVU was founded by Tanguturi Prakasam Pantulu, the then Chief Minister of Andhra, along with S. Govindarajulu Naidu, the first Vice-Chancellor.

faqs.question: What is CMCS at SVU?
faqs.answer: CMCS (College of Management and Computer Science) is an SVU institution offering programs in Business Administration, Commerce, Computer Applications, and Management.

faqs.question: Does SVU offer distance education?
faqs.answer: Yes, SVU offers distance learning through the Directorate of Distance Education (DDE) with UG, PG, and diploma programs.

faqs.question: Does the university provide NCC and NSS?
faqs.answer: Yes, SVU provides NCC and NSS wings for student community development and leadership.

faqs.question: Who is the Principal of the SVU College of Arts?
faqs.answer: Prof. G. Padmanabham is the Principal of the S.V.U. College of Arts. He has been in this role since July 2022. For the most current information, please check the official website.

faqs.question: What is the academic background of Prof. G. Padmanabham, the Principal?
faqs.answer: Prof. G. Padmanabham has an M.A., M.Phil., and Ph.D. in Ancient Indian History, Culture & Archaeology. He has over 30 years of teaching and research experience and has published numerous papers and books.

faqs.question: Who is the Vice-Principal of the SVU College of Arts?
faqs.answer: Prof. S.V. Subba Reddy is the Vice-Principal of the S.V.U. College of Arts. For the most current information, please check the official website.

faqs.question: Which departments are part of the SVU College of Arts?
faqs.answer: Departments include Adult & Continuing Education, Ancient Indian History, Culture & Archaeology, Econometrics, Economics, English, Foreign Languages, Hindi, History, Performing Arts, Philosophy, Political Science & Public Administration, Population Studies & Social Work, Sanskrit, Sociology, South East Asian & Pacific Studies, Tamil, Telugu Studies, and Urdu.

faqs.question: How many departments and centres are in SVU College of Arts?
faqs.answer: There are 28 departments and centres, including AIHC&A, Adult Education, BP.Ed, Econometrics, Economics (R&SF), English, Hindi, History, HRDC Human Rights Commission, Linguistics, 5Years LLB, LLM, Med, MLISC Library Science, Performing Arts, Philosophy, Political Science & Public Administration, Population Studies, Rural Development, Sanskrit, Sociology, SEAP Studies, Master of Social Work, Tamil, Telugu (R&SF), Tourism, Urdu, and Centre for Women Studies.

faqs.question: Who was the founder Principal of SVU College of Arts?
faqs.answer: Prof. S.G. Manavala Ramanujam from the Dept. of Zoology served as the founder Principal from 1955–1958, with 41 principals having occupied the position since.

faqs.question: How many staff members are at SVU College of Arts?
faqs.answer: The college has 48 teaching staff, 86 academic consultants, and 92 non-teaching staff, assisted by Sri. A. Mani (Assistant Registrar) and Sri. G. Krishna Kumar (Superintendent).

faqs.question: Who is the current Principal mentioned for SVU College of Arts?
faqs.answer: Prof. G. PADMANABHAM, M.A., M.Phil., Ph.D. from the Dept. of Sanskrit, is listed as Principal.

faqs.question: Who is Dr. K. Sudha Rani and what is her role?
faqs.answer: Dr. K. Sudha Rani is the Principal of SVU College of Arts. Her contact email is kasireddysudharani@gmail.com.

faqs.question: What is Dr. K. Sudha Rani's professional experience?
faqs.answer: She began as Assistant Professor in Adult and Continuing Education in 1992 and now serves as Principal.

faqs.question: What events has Dr. K. Sudha Rani organized?
faqs.answer: She organized 10 national seminars as Director, 6 as Co-Director, and extension activities like vocational training, medical camps, and career guidance camps.

faqs.question: Who is the Vice Principal of SVU College of Arts?
faqs.answer: Dr. P. Bhaskar Reddy, HOD and Chairman BOS, with qualifications M.A., M.Phil., Ph.D., PG.Dip.in Epigraphy, specializes in Cultural History, Epigraphy, Museology, and Temple Studies. His email is pbreddy1962@gmail.com.

faqs.question: Who governs the College of Arts?
faqs.answer: The college is governed by the Principal, under the administration of the Vice-Chancellor and Registrar of SVU.

faqs.question: Is Political Science offered?
faqs.answer: Yes, through the Department of Political Science & Public Administration.

faqs.question: Are there non-teaching staff at the College of Arts?
faqs.answer: Yes, there is a dedicated team of administrative officers, superintendents, and clerks.

faqs.question: Who heads the administrative staff?
faqs.answer: The Administrative Officer (AO) of the College of Arts.

faqs.question: Who is the current Vice-Chancellor of Sri Venkateswara University?
faqs.answer: Prof. Tata Narasinga Rao is the Hon'ble Vice-Chancellor. He leads efforts to transform the university into a world-class institute, emphasizing research, innovation, and alignment with NEP-2020. The university, established in 1954, holds NAAC A+ accreditation and excels in NIRF, BRICS, QS, and Asia rankings.

faqs.question: Who is the current Rector of Sri Venkateswara University?
faqs.answer: Prof. Ch. Appa Rao is the current Rector. The university offers over 99 UG courses, 54 PG courses, and doctoral programs across four constituent colleges and 191 affiliated colleges. It follows a semester system and focuses on research in energy, earth sciences, and humanities.

faqs.question: Who is the current Registrar of Sri Venkateswara University?
faqs.answer: Prof. M. Bhupathi Naidu is the current Registrar. The university supports research with funding from UGC, DST, and international sources, plus Wi-Fi, hostels, and guest houses for scholars. Ongoing developments include e-classrooms, incubation centers, and smart campus features.

faqs.question: What is the Executive Council at SVU?
faqs.answer: The Executive Council is the principal executive body of the University. It manages and administers the revenue and property of the University and has control over all its administrative affairs. The Chairman is the Vice-Chancellor (Phone: 0877-2289412). Members include the Rector, Principal Secretary (Higher Education), Special Secretary (Finance), Executive Officer TTD, Chairman APSCHE, Principals of SVU Colleges, Professors from various departments, industry representatives, and the Registrar (Phone: 0877-2289414).

faqs.question: What is the Academic Senate at SVU?
faqs.answer: The Academic Senate is the principal academic body of the University. It has the authority to oversee and regulate academic matters, including curricula, instruction, and examinations. The Chairman is the Vice-Chancellor. Members mirror the Executive Council core (Rector, government secretaries, TTD EO, APSCHE Chairman) plus Deans of faculties (Arts, Commerce, Sciences, Engineering, Law, etc.), college principals, and experts from institutions like IISc and University of Delhi.

Subba Rao (multiple terms in 1960s), Dr. M.J. Kesava Murthy (1976-1979), Prof. K. Chandrasekhar Reddy (1981-1984), and Prof. O. Mahammad Hussain (2021-2024).

faqs.question: Who are some former Joint Registrars of SVU?
faqs.answer: Former Joint Registrars include: Sri. M. Anandam Chetty (1994-1996), Sri. P. Nagendra Varma (1996), Sri. M. Govindarajulu (1996-1997), Sri. A. Gurunatham (1997-1998), and others up to Sri. K.L. Nagamma (2014-2016).

faqs.question: Who are the key officers at SVU?
faqs.answer: The key officers of the university typically include the Vice-Chancellor, Rector, Registrar, Finance Officer, Dean of College Development Council, and the Principals of the constituent colleges.

faqs.question: Who is the present Vice-Chancellor of Sri Venkateswara University (SVU)?
faqs.answer: The current Vice-Chancellor of SVU is the chief academic and administrative head of the university. You can find their name, profile, and message on the “Vice-Chancellor” page of the official SVU website.

faqs.question: What are the main responsibilities of the Vice-Chancellor of SVU?
faqs.answer: The Vice-Chancellor is responsible for providing academic leadership, overall administrative control, strategic planning, policy implementation, and representing the university at state, national, and international forums.

faqs.question: How is the Vice-Chancellor of SVU appointed?
faqs.answer: The Vice-Chancellor is appointed by the Government / Chancellor as per the relevant University Act, statutes, and regulations, usually based on recommendations of a duly constituted selection committee.

faqs.question: What is the tenure of the Vice-Chancellor at SVU?
faqs.answer: The tenure is generally fixed by the university’s governing statutes or state government regulations (for example, often 3–4 years or until a specified age limit), as notified in the appointment order.

faqs.question: How can I read the Vice-Chancellor’s official message to students and stakeholders?
faqs.answer: The Vice-Chancellor’s official message or “From the VC’s Desk” is usually available on the Vice-Chancellor page of the university website.

faqs.question: What kind of initiatives does the Vice-Chancellor typically focus on?
faqs.answer: The Vice-Chancellor typically focuses on academic excellence, research promotion, infrastructure development, digitalization, industry collaboration, student welfare, and quality assurance initiatives like NAAC/NIRF.

faqs.question: Can students or parents meet the Vice-Chancellor personally?
faqs.answer: Yes, but usually with a prior appointment. Meeting procedures and office timings are generally mentioned on the VC page or can be obtained from the university office.

faqs.question: How can I contact the Vice-Chancellor’s office?
faqs.answer: Contact details such as office phone number, email ID, and postal address are normally listed on the Vice-Chancellor page of the official website.

faqs.question: Does the Vice-Chancellor teach regular classes?
faqs.answer: In most cases, the Vice-Chancellor’s role is primarily administrative and academic leadership, so teaching is limited; however, they may deliver special lectures, convocations, and key academic talks.

faqs.question: What is the role of the Vice-Chancellor in examinations and results?
faqs.answer: The Vice-Chancellor oversees examination-related policies, approves academic calendars, and ensures fair conduct of examinations through the Controller of Examinations and other statutory officers.

faqs.question: What is the role of the Vice-Chancellor in faculty recruitment?
faqs.answer: The Vice-Chancellor chairs or supervises selection committees, ensures adherence to UGC/state norms, and approves appointments recommended by the duly constituted selection bodies.

faqs.question: Does the Vice-Chancellor interact with student bodies and unions?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Vice-Chancellor typically interacts with student representatives on matters of academic quality, campus discipline, facilities, and welfare schemes.

faqs.question: How is the Vice-Chancellor involved in research and innovation at SVU?
faqs.answer: The Vice-Chancellor encourages research centers, promotes collaborations, supports funding proposals, and provides policy-level support for innovation and patents.

faqs.question: What is the role of the Vice-Chancellor in accreditation and rankings?
faqs.answer: The Vice-Chancellor leads the university’s efforts in NAAC, NIRF, and other rankings/accreditations by coordinating departments, ensuring data quality, and framing improvement strategies.

faqs.question: Where can I find the Vice-Chancellor’s academic and professional profile?
faqs.answer: The detailed profile, qualifications, publications, and previous positions of the Vice-Chancellor are usually given on the “Vice-Chancellor” page of the university website.

faqs.question: Where can I see the list of former Vice-Chancellors of SVU?
faqs.answer: You can see the complete list of former Vice-Chancellors on the “Former Vice-Chancellors” section of the official SVU website.

faqs.question: What information is provided about former Vice-Chancellors?
faqs.answer: Typically, the page includes names, tenure periods, and sometimes photographs and brief profiles or major contributions.

faqs.question: Why does SVU maintain a list of former Vice-Chancellors?
faqs.answer: The list acknowledges their contributions to the growth of the university and serves as part of the institution’s historical record.

faqs.question: Can I see the tenure period of each former Vice-Chancellor?
faqs.answer: Yes, the tenure dates (from–to) are usually mentioned beside each name on the Former Vice-Chancellors page.

faqs.question: Are photographs of former Vice-Chancellors available?
faqs.answer: Many universities include photographs for recognition; if available, these will be displayed on the Former Vice-Chancellors page.

faqs.question: Does the page highlight milestones achieved under each Vice-Chancellor?
faqs.answer: Some profiles may mention key milestones; otherwise, such details may be found in annual reports, convocation addresses, or university history documents.

faqs.question: Are any former Vice-Chancellors still associated with SVU in an honorary role?
faqs.answer: If so, it may be mentioned in the respective profiles or other sections of the website like “Distinguished Alumni/Faculty” or news/announcements.

faqs.question: How can I know which Vice-Chancellor served for the longest duration?
faqs.answer: By checking the tenure periods listed for each former Vice-Chancellor and comparing the durations.

faqs.question: Can I cite information about former Vice-Chancellors for academic or media work?
faqs.answer: Yes, but you should always verify spellings, dates, and positions from the official website or university publications before citing.

faqs.question: Does the former Vice-Chancellors list get updated when a new VC is appointed?
faqs.answer: Yes, when a new Vice-Chancellor takes charge, the previous one is typically moved to the Former Vice-Chancellors list with updated tenure details.

faqs.question: Who is the Rector of SVU?
faqs.answer: The Rector is a senior academic/administrative officer who assists the Vice-Chancellor. The current Rector’s name and profile are available on the “Rector” page of the university website.

faqs.question: What is the role of the Rector at SVU?
faqs.answer: The Rector assists the Vice-Chancellor in academic and administrative matters, may act on behalf of the Vice-Chancellor when authorized, and coordinates among various faculties and departments.

faqs.question: How is the Rector appointed?
faqs.answer: The Rector is generally appointed from among senior professors as per the statutes and regulations of the university, based on recommendations and approval of the competent authorities.

faqs.question: What is the tenure of the Rector?
faqs.answer: The tenure is determined by the university’s rules—often a fixed term or until superannuation, as mentioned in the appointment order.

faqs.question: What are the academic responsibilities of the Rector?
faqs.answer: The Rector may oversee academic planning, curriculum development, examination processes, research coordination, and quality enhancement activities.

faqs.question: Does the Rector have administrative powers?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Rector usually has specific administrative powers delegated by the Vice-Chancellor or defined in the university statutes.

faqs.question: Can the Rector act as Vice-Chancellor in the VC’s absence?
faqs.answer: In many universities, the Rector or a designated officer is authorized to perform the duties of the Vice-Chancellor during their absence, as per statutes.

faqs.question: How can I contact the Rector’s office?
faqs.answer: The Rector’s office contact details such as phone numbers and email IDs are normally available on the Rector page on the university website.

faqs.question: Does the Rector interact with students and research scholars?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Rector often interacts with students, research scholars, and faculty regarding academic policies, grievances, and developmental activities.

faqs.question: Is there a message or profile note from the Rector on the website?
faqs.answer: Often, there is a brief profile and a message addressed to stakeholders on the Rector’s page.

faqs.question: What is the difference between the roles of Rector and Vice-Chancellor?
faqs.answer: The Vice-Chancellor is the chief executive and academic head, while the Rector supports and assists the VC and may focus more on internal academic coordination.

faqs.question: What qualifications are typically required to become a Rector?
faqs.answer: The Rector is generally a senior professor with distinguished academic credentials and administrative experience, as specified by the university statutes.

faqs.question: Does the Rector chair any specific committees?
faqs.answer: The Rector may chair or be a member of academic committees, discipline committees, or developmental boards, as notified by the university.

faqs.question: Where can I find more details about the Rector’s achievements?
faqs.answer: More details can be found on the Rector’s profile page, departmental page, or through university newsletters and reports.

faqs.question: How often is the Rector’s page updated?
faqs.answer: The page is updated whenever there is a change in position, new responsibilities, or updated contact information.

faqs.question: Where can I see the list of former Rectors of SVU?
faqs.answer: The “Former Rectors” page on the official website lists the individuals who previously held the Rector position.

faqs.question: What details are shown about former Rectors?
faqs.answer: Typically, it includes names and tenure periods, and sometimes photographs or brief profiles.

faqs.question: Why does the university list former Rectors?
faqs.answer: To honor their service and maintain a historical record of the university’s academic leadership.

faqs.question: Are the tenure dates of former Rectors mentioned?
faqs.answer: Yes, in most cases, the from–to dates of service are mentioned beside each name.

faqs.question: Can I use information about former Rectors for research or documentation?
faqs.answer: Yes, but please cross-check names and dates from the official website before using them in any formal document.

faqs.question: Is the list of former Rectors updated regularly?

faqs.question: What is the Executive Council of SVU?

faqs.question: What is Dr. V. Padmavathi's academic and professional background?
faqs.answer: Dr. V. Padmavathi holds M.Sc. and Ph.D. degrees. She has 31 years of teaching and research experience in Organic Chemistry, specializing in heterocyclic chemistry and the synthesis of pharmacologically potential multifunctional heteroaromatics. She has also worked as an INSA Fellow and conducted post-doctoral research in the USA.

faqs.question: How many Ph.D. and M.Phil. degrees have been awarded under Dr. V. Padmavathi's guidance?
faqs.answer: Under Dr. V. Padmavathi's guidance, 33 Ph.D. and 13 M.Phil. degrees have been awarded.

faqs.question: What are some of the research areas and achievements of Dr. V. Padmavathi?
faqs.answer: Dr. V. Padmavathi's research focuses on heterocyclic chemistry, synthesis of pharmacologically potential molecules, and structure-activity relationships of drug analogues. She has worked on the synthesis of A-ring analogues of Taxanes and COX-2 inhibitors. She has also developed collaborations for bioassays and successfully accomplished 10 research projects funded by various organizations, with a current project funded by CSIR. She has published over 260 articles and presented her work at national and international conferences.

faqs.question: What advanced synthetic methodologies does Dr. V. Padmavathi employ in her research?
faqs.answer: Dr. V. Padmavathi utilizes advanced synthetic methodologies such as sonochemistry, microwave irradiation, and green synthesis for the construction of different molecules.

faqs.question: What is the administrative structure of the College of Engineering?
faqs.answer: The College is run on democratic lines with decentralization of administration. The Principal is assisted by the College Academic Council, which includes the Principal, Vice-Principal, Warden, and Heads of all departments. Each department also has committees for decision-making, and each academic discipline has a Board of Studies for curricular aspects.

faqs.question: What kind of infrastructure is available at the College of Engineering?
faqs.answer: The College has extensive building accommodation including lecture and seminar halls, e-classrooms, drawing halls, administration and office accommodation, faculty rooms, laboratories, and workshops. Other infrastructure includes a College Computer Centre and adequate facilities for games and sports activities, including a separate Gymnasium for boys and girls.

faqs.question: Where did Prof. O.V.S. Reddy work before joining Sri Venkateswara University?
faqs.answer: Before joining S.V.University, Tirupati, he worked for his PhD at CSIR-CFTRI, Mysore after qualifying UGC-CSIR NET.

faqs.question: What international experience does Prof. O.V.S. Reddy have?
faqs.answer: Prof. O.V.S. Reddy visited Italy in the year 2006 for one year, utilizing the Italian Govt. Scholarship programme, and completed a PG Diploma in Bioinformatics.

faqs.question: How many PhD students has Dr. Obulam Vijaya Sarathi Reddy guided?
faqs.answer: Dr. Obulam Vijaya Sarathi Reddy has guided nineteen PhD students.

faqs.question: What kind of awards has Prof. O.V.S. Reddy received?
faqs.answer: Prof. O.V.S. Reddy has received several awards, including the UGC-Mid-career award.

facilities.name: SVU Central Library
facilities.description: One of the largest libraries in the state, housing over 3.5 lakh books, thousands of journals, and offering digital resources. It's a central hub for academic and research activities.
facilities.location: SVU Campus, Tirupati

facilities.name: SVU College of Arts
facilities.description: A constituent college offering a wide range of courses in humanities, social sciences, languages, and fine arts. It has 22 departments.

facilities.name: SVU College of Sciences
facilities.description: A constituent college focused on life sciences, physical sciences, and earth sciences, comprising 27 departments.
facilities.location: SVU Campus, Tirupati

facilities.name: SVU College of Engineering
facilities.description: Established in 1959, the College of Engineering offers B.Tech, M.Tech, and Ph.D. programs across various engineering disciplines. It has departments for Civil, Mechanical, EEE, ECE, CSE, and Chemical Engineering.

facilities.name: SVU College of Commerce, Management & Computer Science

facilities.name: SVU College of Pharmaceutical Sciences

academic_programs.fee: Varies by specialization and year. Please check the official admission portal.

placements.summary: Sri Venkateswara University has a dedicated placement cell that works towards providing job opportunities to its students. The median package offered to UG (4-year) students in 2023 was INR 4.15 LPA, and for PG (2-year) students, it was INR 6.50 LPA.

syllabi.summary: Detailed syllabi for all undergraduate (degree) and postgraduate courses are available on the Sri Venkateswara University's official website (svuniversity.edu.in). These are updated periodically. Students should refer to the website for the latest curriculum for their respective courses. The website typically provides PDF documents for each subject under sections like 'Degree Course Syllabus' and 'PG Course Syllabus'.
